t: Luke 10
Sending Out the Seventy-Two
After*p this, the Lord appointed seventy-two others, and he sent them ahead of him in pairs to every town and place where he himself was about to go.
He told them, “The*r harvest*r is*r abundant,*r but*r the*r workers*r are*r few.*r Therefore,*r pray*r to*r the*r Lord*r of*r the*r harvest*r to*r send*r out*r workers*r into*r his*r harvest.*r
Now*r go;*r I’m*r sending*r you*r out*r like*r lambs*r among*r wolves.*r
Don’t*r carry*r a*r money-bag,*r traveling*r bag,*r or*r sandals;*r don’t*r greet*r anyone*r along*r the*r road.*r
Whatever*r house*r you*r enter,*r first*r say,*r ‘Peace*r to*r this*r household.’*r
If*r a*r person*r of*r peace*r is*r there,*r your*r peace*r will*r rest*r on*r him;*r but*r if*r not,*r it*r will*r return*r to*r you.*r
Remain*r in*r the*r same*r house,*r eating*r and*r drinking*r what*r they*r offer,*r for*r the*r worker*r is*r worthy*r of*r his*r wages.*r Don’t*r move*r from*r house*r to*r house.*r
When*r you*r enter*r any*r town,*r and*r they*r welcome*r you,*r eat*r the*r things*r set*r before*r you.*r
Heal*r the*r sick*r who*r are*r there,*r and*r tell*r them,*r ‘The*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r come*r near*r you.’*r
When*r you*r enter*r any*r town,*r and*r they*r don’t*r welcome*r you,*r go*r out*r into*r its*r streets*r and*r say,*r

‘We*r are*r wiping*r off*r even*r the*r dust*r of*r your*r town*r that*r clings*r to*r our*r feet*r as*r a*r witness*r against*r you.*r Know*r this*r for*r certain:*r The*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r come*r near.’*r
I*r tell*r you,*r on*r that*r day*r it*r will*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r Sodom*r than*r for*r that*r town.*r
Unrepentant Towns

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r Chorazin!*r Woe*r to*r you,*r Bethsaida!*r For*r if*r the*r miracles*r that*r were*r done*r in*r you*r had*r been*r done*r in*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon,*r they*r would*r have*r repented*r long*r ago,*r sitting*r in*r sackcloth*r and*r ashes.*r
But*r it*r will*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon*r at*r the*r judgment*r than*r for*r you.*r
And*r you,*r Capernaum,*r will*r you*r be*r exalted*r to*r heaven?*r No,*r you*r will*r go*r down*r to*r Hades.*r
Whoever*r listens*r to*r you*r listens*r to*r me.*r Whoever*r rejects*r you*r rejects*r me.*r And*r whoever*r rejects*r me*r rejects*r the*r one*r who*r sent*r me.”*r
The Return of the Seventy-Two
The*p seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name.”
He*p said to them, “I*r watched*r Satan*r fall*r from*r heaven*r like*r lightning.*r
Look,*r I*r have*r given*r you*r the*r authority*r to*r trample*r on*r snakes*r and*r scorpions*r and*r over*r all*r the*r power*r of*r the*r enemy;*r nothing*r at*r all*r will*r harm*r you.*r
However,*r don’t*r rejoice*r that*r the*r spirits*r submit*r to*r you,*r but*r rejoice*r that*r your*r names*r are*r written*r in*r heaven.”*r
The Son Reveals the Father

At*p that time he rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I*r praise*r you,*r Father,*r Lord*r of*r heaven*r and*r earth,*r because*r you*r have*r hidden*r these*r things*r from*r the*r wise*r and*r intelligent*r and*r revealed*r them*r to*r infants.*r Yes,*r Father,*r because*r this*r was*r your*r good*r pleasure.*r

All*r things*r have*r been*r entrusted*r to*r me*r by*r my*r Father.*r No*r one*r knows*r who*r the*r Son*r is*r except*r the*r Father,*r and*r who*r the*r Father*r is*r except*r the*r Son,*r and*r anyone*r to*r whom*r the*r Son*r desires*r to*r reveal*r him.”*r
Then*p turning to his disciples he said privately, “Blessed*r are*r the*r eyes*r that*r see*r the*r things*r you*r see!*r

For*r I*r tell*r you*r that*r many*r prophets*r and*r kings*r wanted*r to*r see*r the*r things*r you*r see*r but*r didn’t*r see*r them;*r to*r hear*r the*r things*r you*r hear*r but*r didn’t*r hear*r them.”*r
The Parable of the Good Samaritan
Then*p an expert in the law stood up to test him, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
“What*rp is*r written*r in*r the*r law?”*r he asked him. “How*r do*r you*r read*r it?”*r

He*p answered, “Love*i the*i Lord*i your*i God*i with*i all*i your*i heart,*i with*i all*i your*i soul,*i with*i all*i your*i strength,*i and*i with*i all*i your*i mind,”*i and “your*i neighbor*i as*i yourself.”*i
“You’ve*rp answered*r correctly,”*r he told him. “Do*r this*r and*r you*r will*r live.”*r
But*p wanting to justify himself, he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”

Jesus*p took up the question and said, “A*r man*r was*r going*r down*r from*r Jerusalem*r to*r Jericho*r and*r fell*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r robbers.*r They*r stripped*r him,*r beat*r him*r up,*r and*r fled,*r leaving*r him*r half*r dead.*r
A*r priest*r happened*r to*r be*r going*r down*r that*r road.*r When*r he*r saw*r him,*r he*r passed*r by*r on*r the*r other*r side.*r
In*r the*r same*r way,*r a*r Levite,*r when*r he*r arrived*r at*r the*r place*r and*r saw*r him,*r passed*r by*r on*r the*r other*r side.*r
But*r a*r Samaritan*r on*r his*r journey*r came*r up*r to*r him,*r and*r when*r he*r saw*r the*r man,*r he*r had*r compassion.*r

He*r went*r over*r to*r him*r and*r bandaged*r his*r wounds,*r pouring*r on*r olive*r oil*r and*r wine.*r Then*r he*r put*r him*r on*r his*r own*r animal,*r brought*r him*r to*r an*r inn,*r and*r took*r care*r of*r him.*r

The*r next*r day*r he*r took*r out*r two*r denarii,*r gave*r them*r to*r the*r innkeeper,*r and*r said,*r ‘Take*r care*r of*r him.*r When*r I*r come*r back*r I’ll*r reimburse*r you*r for*r whatever*r extra*r you*r spend.’*r
“Which*rp of*r these*r three*r do*r you*r think*r proved*r to*r be*r a*r neighbor*r to*r the*r man*r who*r fell*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r the*r robbers?”*r
“The*p one who showed mercy to him,” he said. Then*p Jesus told him, “Go*r and*r do*r the*r same.”*r
Martha and Mary
While*p they were traveling, he entered a village, and a woman named Martha welcomed him into her home.
She had a sister named Mary, who also sat at the Lord’s feet and was listening to what he said.
But Martha was distracted by her many tasks, and she came up and asked, “Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to serve alone? So tell her to give me a hand.”
The*p Lord answered her, “Martha,*r Martha,*r you*r are*r worried*r and*r upset*r about*r many*r things,*r
but*r one*r thing*r is*r necessary.*r Mary*r has*r made*r the*r right*r choice,*r and*r it*r will*r not*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r her.”*r
